title: Ed Ruscha’s ‘Hurting the Word Radio #2’ Could Fetch $30M-$40M
text:
Ed Ruscha’s Hurting the Word Radio #2, 1964—among the first announced highlights of Christie’s fall post-war and contemporary art sales—will be hitting the auction block for the first time in November with an estimate between $30 million and $40 million.

This early example of Ruscha’s pop text paintings could beat the artist’s current auction record of $30.4 million, including fees, for Smash, 1963. That record, achieved in November 2014 at Christie’s in New York, doubled a low estimate of $15 million, which in itself was...
description: Christie’s to sell the pop artist’s 1960s text painting from the collection of Joan and Jack Quinn
